title: 107_hr5198
content: The Act may be cited as the "Premier Certified Lenders Program Improvement Act of 2002". The Premier Certified Lenders Program (PCLP) has been successful in helping small businesses expand. Increasing the number of premier certified lenders will provide more resources to small businesses as the Small Business Administration downsizes. Requiring premier certified lenders to maintain unnecessarily large loss reserve accounts limits their ability to serve additional small businesses. Premier certified lenders should be required to. Premier certified lenders should maintain loss reserve accounts to reflect the risk of loss associated with PCLP loans, protecting taxpayers and improving economic development for small businesses. Premier certified lenders are required to maintain loss reserve accounts for PCLP loans to mitigate risk and support small business development. Premier certified lenders must maintain loss reserve accounts for PCLP loans to mitigate risk and support small business development. Section 508(c) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow qualified high loss reserve PCLs to elect an alternative loss reserve option in place of certain requirements. Premier certified lenders can elect an alternative loss reserve option for a calendar quarter, allowing them to make necessary contributions to ensure a minimum loss reserve of $25,000. Contributions must be sufficient to protect the Federal. The company employs a third-party auditor to protect the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with its portfolio of PCLP loans. A qualified high loss reserve PCL is designated as a premier certified lender with a loss reserve of at least $25,000 and a process for analyzing loan risks. The company employs a third-party auditor to certify the adequacy of its loss reserve for protecting the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with its PCLP loan portfolio. The company must have a third-party auditor certify the adequacy of its loss reserve to protect the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with its PCLP loan portfolio. The term 'calendar quarter' is defined as specific periods throughout the year in this section. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to the Small Business Investment Act of 1958.
